field.name: FWDE
field.description: FIFO Warning DMA Enable\n Enables/disables DMA requests

field.name: FWIE
field.description: FIFO Warning Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables FIFO warning interrupts

field.name: FEIE
field.description: FIFO Error Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables FIFO error interrupts

field.name: SEIE
field.description: Sync Error Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables sync error interrupts

field.name: WSIE
field.description: Word Start Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables word start interrupts

field.name: FWF
field.description: FIFO Warning Flag\n Indicates that an enabled transmit FIFO is empty

field.name: FEF
field.description: FIFO Error Flag\n Indicates that an enabled transmit FIFO has underrun.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: SEF
field.description: Sync Error Flag\n Indicates that an error in the externally-generated frame sync has been detected.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: WSF
field.description: Word Start Flag\n Indicates that the start of the configured word has been detected.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: SR
field.description: Software Reset\n When set, resets the internal transmitter logic including the FIFO pointers.\n Software-visible registers are not affected, except for the status

field.name: BCE
field.description: Bit Clock Enable\n Enables the receive bit clock, separately from RE.\n This field is automatically set whenever RE is set. When software clears this field, the receive bit clock remains enabled, and this field remains set, until the end of the current frame

field.name: DBGE
field.description: Debug Enable\n Enables/disables receiver operation in Debug mode. The receive bit clock is not affected by Debug mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled in Debug mode\t, after completing the current frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter is enabled, or transmitter has been disabled and has not yet reached end of frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is generated externally in Slave mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is generated internally in Master mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is active high with drive outputs on rising edge and sample inputs on falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is active low with drive outputs on falling edge and sample inputs on rising edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous mode (external bit clock) or Bus Clock selected (internal bit clock)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous with receiver (external bit clock) or Master Clock 1 selected (internal bit clock)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous with another SAI transmitter (external bit clock) or Master Clock 2 selected (internal bit clock)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous with another SAI receiver (external bit clock) or Master Clock 3 selected (internal bit clock)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data channel N is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data channel N is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Frame sync is generated externally in Slave mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Frame sync is generated internally in Master mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Frame sync asserts with the first bit of the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Frame sync asserts one bit before the first bit of the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Word N is masked. The transmit data pins are tri-stated when masked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No enabled receive FIFO is full

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver is disabled in Debug mode, after completing the current frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver is enabled in Debug mode

enumeratedValue.description: Receiver is enabled, or receiver has been disabled and has not yet reached end of frame

enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is generated externally in Slave mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bit clock is generated internally in Master mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Bit Clock is active high with drive outputs on rising edge and sample inputs on falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bit Clock is active low with drive outputs on falling edge and sample inputs on rising edge

field.name: WDFL
field.description: Word Flag Configuration\n Configures which word the start of word flag is set.\n The value written should be one less than the word number (for example, write zero to configure for the first word in the frame)

field.name: RCE
field.description: Receive Channel Enable\nEnables the corresponding data channel for receive operation

field.name: FSD
field.description: Frame Sync Direction\n Configures the direction of the frame sync

field.name: FSP
field.description: Frame Sync Polarity\n Configures the polarity of the frame sync

field.name: FSE
field.description: Frame Sync Early\n Control where frame sync asserts relative to 1st bit of the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Asserts one bit before first bit

field.name: MF
field.description: MSB First\n Configures whether the LSB or the MSB is transmitted/received first

field.name: SYWD
field.description:
Sync Width
 Configures the length of the frame sync in number of bit clocks.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bit clocks.
 or example, write 0 for the frame sync to assert for one bit clock only

field.name: FRSZ
field.description:
Frame size
 Configures the number of words in each frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of words in the frame.
 For example, write 0 for one word per frame

field.name: FBT
field.description:
First Bit Shifted
 Configures the bit index for the first bit transmitted for each word in the frame.
 If configured for MSB First, the index of the next bit transmitted is one less than the current bit transmitted.
 If configured for LSB First, the index of the next bit transmitted is one more than the current bit transmitted

field.name: W0W
field.description:
Word 0 Width
 Configures the number of bits in the first word in each frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bits in the first word.
 Word width of less than 8 bits is not supported if there is only one word per frame

field.name: WNW
field.description:
Word N Width
 Configures the number of bits in each word, for each word except the first in the frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bits per word.
 The value of WNW must be greater than or equal to the value of W0W even when there is only one word in each frame.
 Word width of less than 8 bits is not supported

field.name: RDR
field.description: Receive Data Register\n Reads from this register when the receive FIFO is not empty will return the data from the top of the receive FIFO.\n Reads from this register when the receive FIFO is empty are ignored

field.name: RWM
field.description: Receive Word Mask\n Configures whether the receive word is masked (received data ignored and\n not written to receive FIFO) for the corresponding word in the frame

field.name: MICS
field.description: MCLK Input Clock Select\nSelects the clock input to the MCLK divider

field.name: MOE
field.description: MCLK Output Enable\n Enables the MCLK divider and configures the MCLK signal pin as an output.\n When software clears this field, it remains set until the MCLK divider is fully disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is input bypassing the MCLK Divider

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is output from the MCLK Divider

field.name: DUF
field.description: Divider Update Flag\n Provides the status of on-the-fly updates to the MCLK divider ratio\n Updates to the MCLK divider ratio are blocked while this flag remains set

register.name: MDR
register.description: SAI MCLK Divide Register\n Sets the MCLK divide ratio such that: MCLK output = MCLK input * ( (FRACT + 1) / (DIVIDE + 1) ).\n FRACT must be set equal or less than the value in the DIVIDE field

field.name: DIVIDE
field.description: MCLK Divide\nSets the MCLK divide value

field.name: FRACT
field.description: MCLK Fraction\nSets the MCLK fraction value
